body_html:
Hi!

Okay. On a different machine with the master version of data_loader, I got this error:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/runpy.py", line 184, in _run_module_as_main
    "__main__", mod_spec)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/runpy.py", line 85, in _run_code
    exec(code, run_globals)
  File "/home/src/bin/signal_model/train.py", line 475, in <module>
    hparams=hparams)
  File "/home/src/bin/signal_model/train.py", line 437, in main
    trainer.run_epoch(train=True, trial_run=is_trial_run)
  File "/home/src/bin/signal_model/train.py", line 190, in run_epoch
    batch, train=train, sample=draw_sample, epoch_start_time=start)
  File "/home/src/bin/signal_model/train.py", line 343, in _run_step
    output_device=self.device.index)
  File "/home/michaelp/.local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/torch/nn/parallel/data_parallel.py", line 168, in data_parallel
    outputs = parallel_apply(replicas, inputs, module_kwargs, used_device_ids)
  File "/home/michaelp/.local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/torch/nn/parallel/parallel_apply.py", line 67, in parallel_apply
    thread.start()
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/threading.py", line 837, in start
    raise RuntimeError("thread.__init__() not called")
RuntimeError: thread.__init__() not called

This one is a bit more interpretable. I still need to try a different version of Python.

body:
Hi!

Okay. On a different machine with the master version of data_loader, I got this error:
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/runpy.py", line 184, in _run_module_as_main
    "__main__", mod_spec)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/runpy.py", line 85, in _run_code
    exec(code, run_globals)
  File "/home/src/bin/signal_model/train.py", line 475, in <module>
    hparams=hparams)
  File "/home/src/bin/signal_model/train.py", line 437, in main
    trainer.run_epoch(train=True, trial_run=is_trial_run)
  File "/home/src/bin/signal_model/train.py", line 190, in run_epoch
    batch, train=train, sample=draw_sample, epoch_start_time=start)
  File "/home/src/bin/signal_model/train.py", line 343, in _run_step
    output_device=self.device.index)
  File "/home/michaelp/.local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/torch/nn/parallel/data_parallel.py", line 168, in data_parallel
    outputs = parallel_apply(replicas, inputs, module_kwargs, used_device_ids)
  File "/home/michaelp/.local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/torch/nn/parallel/parallel_apply.py", line 67, in parallel_apply
    thread.start()
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/threading.py", line 837, in start
    raise RuntimeError("thread.__init__() not called")
RuntimeError: thread.__init__() not called
```
This one is a bit more interpretable. I still need to try a different version of Python.
